speaker: ex
dialog: Excuse me. The policeman who buys a chef's salad here every night...

speaker: faye
dialog: You mean No. 633? He's off today.

speaker: ex
dialog: Isn't he off on Saturdays?

speaker: faye
dialog: He changed shifts. Didn't he tell you?

speaker: ex
dialog: If you see him again, could you please give him this?

speaker: faye
dialog: Sure, no problem.

speaker: ex
dialog: Thank you.

speaker: faye
dialog: Of course, I knows it's not right to open it without permission. (Faye glances around, waiting for the flight attendant to leave)

speaker: faye
dialog: (Faye takes a deep breath, mustering up the courage to open the letter. She carefully tears the envelope open and unfolds the letter, her curiosity getting the better of her.)

speaker: faye
dialog: (Inside, she finds a key and a flight ticket with a note that reads - Change of flight. Your plane is cancelled.)

speaker: cop
dialog: (several days later) Black coffee. Thanks.

speaker: faye
dialog: A girl waited around a long time for you last night. A stewardess. She left a letter for you.

speaker: cop
dialog: Really?

speaker: faye
dialog: You wanna read it?

speaker: cop
dialog: After my coffee.

speaker: faye
dialog: Hey, your letter!

speaker: cop
dialog: Keep it for me. I'll get it next time.

speaker: faye
dialog: Give me your address. I'll mail it. Otherwise it'll get lost.

speaker: cop
dialog: Okay.

speaker: faye
dialog: You live close by.

speaker: cop
dialog: Yeah, right down there. Drop by sometime.

speaker: faye
dialog: I will.
